basics.name: Anthony Dellavecchia
basics.label: Software Developer and Creative Technologist
basics.summary: 5+ years of experience in full-stack software development. Interested in solving technical challenges, mastering data structures & algorithms, software engineering, problem solving, open-source, user experience design, and continuous improvement.

work.name: State Farm ®
work.summary:
State Farm is the largest mutual insurance company in the United States. As of 2019, State Farm is ranked 36rd on the list of Fortune 500 companies. "Like a good neighbor, State Farm is there".

Mentor a junior software developer and teach him about our products and processes.

Architectural guidance and high level design decisions about integration layers and services.

Gather business and software requirements, analysis, design, code, implement, test, deploy, and maintain code for multiple products.

Possess an agile and DevOps mindset to adopt change, collaborate daily, improve productivity, deliver value, and pivot based on client needs.

Technologies include Java, Gosu, Spring, JavaScript, Node.js, HTML, CSS, XML, JSON, SOAP Web Services, REST Web Services, Maven, Git

work.name: State Farm ®
work.summary:
State Farm is the largest mutual insurance company in the United States. As of 2017, State Farm is ranked 33rd on the list of Fortune 500 companies. "Like a good neighbor, State Farm is there".

Software development and ownership of multiple products within State Farm's modernized Renter's insurance web application, which allows over 15,000 sales agents to quote, bind, and issue a renter’s policy.

Work on the highest priority technology project within all of State Farm, which is to modernize our Renter's insurance application.

First team to start working on the Renter's insurance application.

Build pieces of the automation framework & scripts for acceptance testing which runs efficiently, and in some cases, produces 150%+ faster results to test and verify business scenarios/logic.

Demonstrate team leadership on a daily basis when communicating with our clients, analyzing how to approach development for software features and user stories, and enabling our team to have a fun work environment.

Possess an agile and DevOps mindset to adopt change, collaborate daily, improve productivity, deliver value, and pivot based on client needs.

Contributions across multiple products and projects, including Auto and Fire insurance product suites.

Object-oriented full-stack software development using open-source software and vendor products (PolicyCenter) to create insurance applications for State Farm’s highest priority project.

Communicate with stakeholders, business partners, and clients to understand expectations for the end user and to provide feedback and suggestions on how to improve their experience.

Technologies include Java, Gosu, Spring, JavaScript, Node.js, HTML, CSS, XML, SOAP Web Services, REST Web Services, Maven, Git

work.name: Bank of America
work.summary:
Bank of America is an American multinational banking and financial services corporation. It is the second largest bank holding company in the United States by assets. As of 2017, Bank of America is the 26th largest company in the United States by total revenue, and Forbes listed Bank of America as the eleventh largest company in the world.

Promoted to "Officer" position after less than 1 year with the team and 1 full year at the company.

Helped develop an application to be used by 4,600+ banks and by 20,000+ employees.

Averaged an individual velocity of >7 points per two week Sprint.

Financial Center Technology and business domain.

work.name: Bank of America
work.summary:
Bank of America is an American multinational banking and financial services corporation. It is the second largest bank holding company in the United States by assets. As of 2016, Bank of America is the 26th largest company in the United States by total revenue, and Forbes listed Bank of America as the eleventh largest company in the world.

Developed a highly critical, modular administrative banking web application for viewing and managing financial center associate schedules. To be used by over 20,000 associates.

Developed, enhanced, tested, supported, maintained, and debugged 3 modules for a banking appointment software application used through-out 4,600 financial centers.

Lead the defect efforts for our application and assisted other developers with their user stories.

Collaborated with Product Owners and SCRUM team members to translate requirements and deliver software components in timeboxed sprints.

Built components, primarily in TypeScript, Handlebars, and LESS, that met business requirements and followed Model-View-Controller architecture.

Worked directly with Senior Management to analyze data and created daily analytics reports for hiring processes.

work.name: GM Financial
work.summary:
GM Financial is the wholly owned captive finance subsidiary of General Motors, and is headquartered in Fort Worth, Texas. The company is a global provider of auto finance solutions, with operations in the U.S., Canada, China, Europe and Latin America. Through long-standing relationships with auto dealers, GM Financial offers attractive retail loan and lease programs to meet the needs of each customer. Also, offered are commercial lending products to dealers to help them finance and grow their businesses.

Communicated with developers, managers, and Assistant Vice Presidents to document, standardize, and implement data warehousing requirements.

Assisted in implementing and facilitating processes for monitoring over 700 ETL workflows in the production environment.

Monitored performance of data workflows and made necessary improvements, such as improving efficiencies and implementing automatic failure notifications.

Execute data loading techniques for all data warehouse load projects which includes extracting a desired subset of data, transforming and converting data, creating mappings from source tables to destination tables, and writing and loading the result data into a target database table.

Perform data load monitoring to increase the efficiency and effectiveness of the loading process.

Facilitate and monitor data warehouse performance.

Work with various levels of software developers to load data into the data warehouse and identify potential problem areas in the source system.

Actively pursue and recommend areas of improvement for data loading techniques and/or population order.

Collaborate with the data modeling team to understand, interpret, and implement data warehouse requirements.

work.name: GM Financial
work.summary:
GM Financial is the wholly owned captive finance subsidiary of General Motors, and is headquartered in Fort Worth, Texas. The company is a global provider of auto finance solutions, with operations in the U.S., Canada, China, Europe and Latin America. Through long-standing relationships with auto dealers, GM Financial offers attractive retail loan and lease programs to meet the needs of each customer. Also, offered are commercial lending products to dealers to help them finance and grow their businesses.

Created mappings in Informatica PowerCenter 9.6.1 to extract, transform, and load data for data warehouse projects.

Developed a data warehouse project to help the business detect and determine fraudulent loan applications.

Programmed in SQL code and mappings to ensure compatibility with all tables and customer specifications.

Created a department-wide living document with centralized information to assist in the onboarding process.

Wrote SQL and PL/SQL queries, in TOAD for Oracle 12.6, to access data and unit test.

Parsed an XML file, located in a CLOB, into a relational database.

work.name: Alpha Kappa Psi
work.summary:
The Professional Development/Program Chairman, at Alpha Kappa Psi, establishs and promotes worthy professional activities for the benefit of the membership of the Mu Rho chapter and other business students. The position works with both faculty and alumni members to achieve comprehensive professional programs.

Plan, execute, and manage all professional events & developmental workshops with the purpose of positively benefiting attendee's professional skills.

Hosted various events such as a LinkedIn workshop for UTD students, a professional photo shoot for members of our organization, a networking event with General Motors Financial, a networking event with PSAV, a networking event with Fisher Investments, and a tour of Dr Pepper Snapple Group.

Propose a specific semester plan for the professional events and promote them through social media outlets such as Facebook.

Submit reports along with attendance of each event, in a timely manner, to the Vice President of Membership.

work.name: Alpha Kappa Psi
work.summary:
Alpha Kappa Psi is the oldest and largest professional business fraternity. With principles to appreciate and demand higher ideals in business and to further the welfare of members, Alpha Kappa Psi promotes educational, friendship, and networking opportunities.

Management of the Mu Rho Chapter's online presence and website. Includes uploading pictures, and general maintenance/upkeep.

Management and knowledge of technologies used by the chapter, such as Slack.

Awareness of relevant and modern business technologies.

work.name: User Experience Club at UT Dallas
work.summary:
The UX Club at UTD strives to increase awareness of and create a community around user-centered design.

Oversee club finances, bank account, and develop the semester’s budget plan.

Responsible for all purchases made for or by the UX club.

Manage the organization’s Wells Fargo bank account to ensure no overdrafts or bank fees are incurred.

Communicate closely with the President and Event Coordinator for feasible budgets for each event.

work.name: Green Eagle Logistics
work.summary:
Green Eagle Logistics provides Asset Recovery and Resource Management through the acquisition, processing and distribution of electronic and industrial equipment.

Assisted in managing and running our online store which has a total product value exceeding $4 million.

Created reports and collaborated with the CEO to discuss potential items we were interested in purchasing.

Increased gross sales from $5,000 to $50,000 per month by implementing new processes and increasing our store volume.

Analyzed electrical equipment specifications to identify and promote through our online store.

Developed logical search trees in a database to create relationships between products.

Enhanced product pages by employing marketing techniques such as photography, videography, and HTML & CSS layouts.

Organized and handled inventory by assigning locations to over 8,000 items.

work.name: Genroku Sushi & Grill
work.summary:
Genroku Sushi & Grill has been serving delicious, authentic Taiwanese and Japanese food for over 15 years.

Processed customer orders and secured proper payments to contribute to monthly revenue of $90k.

Managed and trained 5 newly hired employees to learn tasks and essential serving skills.

Executed multiple tasks for 5-7 tables simultaneously, while serving up to 100 customers, to ensure they have a pleasant dining experience.

work.name: American Sunshine School
work.summary:
American Sunshine School is a buxiban, cram school, located in Taiwan. Students attend the school after their elementary classes to remain competitive with peers in a variety of subjects. 

Taught and educated 35 kindergarten and elementary school students to learn and  improve English speaking, writing, and grammar.

Scheduled and designed lesson plans and course content for 6 classes per week.

Presented material through engaging and creative activities such as songs, plays, stories, and games.

volunteer.summary:
Tarrant Area Food Bank (TAFB) is the primary source of donated food for hunger-relief charities and feeding programs in 13 North Texas counties.

Sorted, inspected, and packed over 16,680 lbs of nutritious food for hungry children, families and seniors. 

Provided more than 13,900 meals to children, families and seniors in the area.

education.institution: The University of Texas at Dallas
The University of Texas at Austin

awards.title: Cum Laude Honors
awards.awarder: The University of Texas at Dallas
awards.summary: Awarded to students with a GPA between 3.533 and 3.72, which also represents the top 15 percent of students, in Naveen Jindal School of Management.

awards.title: Comet Scholarship
awards.summary: University scholarship awarded to select transfer students.

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Achieved a 4.0 GPA during the semester. This award is for students with a GPA among the Top 10% in the Naveen Jindal School of Management.

references.name: Britten Burchardt
references.reference: Anthony is not only an eager and detail oriented co-worker but also an inspiring professional. Anthony was a fantastic person to work with. Anthony is a forward thinking natural leader that cannot be overestimated. Efficient, highly motivated, self motivated and strong team player with a great skill to analyze and summarize ideas. His high expertise and leadership and his straight-to-problems way of thinking makes Anthony view solutions instead of problems. For Anthony the job is always the most important thing to do.

projects.name: JSON Resume using LinkedIn
projects.summary: Developed a chrome extension that parses data from a LinkedIn profile, generates a custom JSON file, and builds a resume that can be viewed online/via PDF.

projects.name: www.AnthonyDellavecchia.com
projects.summary: Developed a website using a static-site generator, Hugo, and a custom domain name for my personal brand. It's deployed using GitHub Pages and Netlify.

projects.name: Automated Job Scraping
projects.summary: Developed a script to automatically search for specific jobs and look for job postings straight from select company career websites, then send a notification to the user. Made with Node.js and Puppeteer.

projects.name: Data Science Competition - Capgemini
projects.summary:
Fall 2016 Data Science Competition for undergraduate students majoring in ITS. The theme of the competition is analytics in the oil and gas industry. For this competition, we analyzed energy sector data and present the resulting insights. The top four teams were recognized and the winning team will be awarded $3,000 in cash prizes sponsored by Capgemini. Our team was a finalist! Our data included 60,000 records and 26 columns. 

I created and designed a user interface using Python in Jupyter notebook. The interface was our front-end guide for our clients. It included tabs and buttons to access our various topics and download links. 

I used logistic regression (GLM) from the Panda package in Python for data wrangling and modeling.

I made a short film that introduces our team to our clients.

projects.name: Deals on Wheels
projects.summary:
Deals on Wheels is a car rental company with abundant customer data. This project was for a database management class.

Our team responsibilities:

Used SQL statements to convert logical database models into database objects.

Inserted rows of data into each table, making use of proper naming conventions, datatype declaration, and use of constraints.

Programmed in SQL by writing statements that will provide the data requested.

Identified potential security threats.

Created a stored procedure, trigger, and view for the database.

projects.name: Organizational Behavior of The Pub
projects.summary: Observed and analyzed the organizational behavior of employees at The Pub, an on campus dining restaurant at the University of Texas at Dallas. Our team collected data by conducting surveys, interviews, and questionares which we used to analyze the underlying behavior of the organization. Our analysis was on the team characteristics, leadership, satisfaction and stress levels, as well as recommendations for The Pub to improve upon. We also presented our findings to the class with a 15 minute Prezi presentation.

projects.name: Rate My Mechanic
projects.summary:
Rate My Mechanic is a mobile web application designed to help users find the right mechanic, at the right time, and in the right place. This project was for a mobile web app development class.

Responsibilities of the project:

Planned, implemented, designed, and deployed a mobile web application.

Created a front end system using HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, and JQuery then use PHP connect the back end database.

projects.name: A Little Help
projects.summary: Created a business proposal as Big Brothers Big Sisters of America, to raise a substantial amount of funding with the intent of positively benefiting at-risk children in Dallas County. Our team identified a problem with at-risk children in Dallas, proposed "A Little Help" program to match mentors with mentees, developed a marketing strategy to execute the project, and planned a budget for the proposal to the Dallas Chamber of Commerce.

projects.name: Build Your Own Box
projects.summary: Created a product proposal using marketing techniques such as a SWOT analysis, marketing mix, marketing objectives, and target markets. Our team wrote a 20 page paper about the proposal as well as a 5 year financial projection, and design of advertisements and product mock-ups.

projects.name: Management Information System Cases
projects.summary:
Given various cases studies for an intro to management information systems class.

My responsibilities included:

Evaluating the overall net present value for multiple projects.

Analyzing the economic feasibility of replacing existing applications with SAP.

Organizing and recording cost-benefits data in Microsoft Excel.

Proposing a plan for implementing a discount rate value to achieve profits.

Presenting graphics for multiple break-even charts
